msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 66 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 22; Text: Q 24:51-61, Q 39:32-Q 40:80; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 300 x 215 mm; Script style: kūfī; Estimated date of production: 2nd (8th) to 3rd (9th) centuries [according to Karatay].

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 and 2 is given, as the fragment consists of two separate parts.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, pp. 10-11: "28 E. H. 22 Kur’an’dan bir bölüm Parşömen. 215mm boy ve 300mm eninde cönk şeklinde 66 yaprak. Sahifede II - III. (VIII - IX) asır kûfisiyle 200mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Y. 1b de hendesi ve geçme tezyinatı havi müzehhep levha, duraklar, secde gülleri aynı üslüpte tezhipli. Yer yer kurtların tahribine uğramış ve kağıtla tamir edilmiştir. Miklepli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu ciltte Zumar (35 [39]) suresinin 32. ayetinin فمن اظلم ممن كذب على الله ... ibaresiyle başlar, yalnız ayni surenin 50, 51, 52 ayetleri hattat tarafından unutulmuş, Y. 17b. Mü’min (40) suresi Y. 49b ye kadar devamla ayni surenin 80. ayetindeki في صدوركم ...kelimesi ile bu sure biter; Nūr (24) suresinin 51. ayetinden aynı surenin 53. ayetine kadar, ayni surenin 55. ayeti ile devam ediyor. Ve bu sure دينهم الذى ارتضى لهم ibaresiyle bitiyor; Y. 52a da aynı surenin 53. ayetiإن الله خبير بما تعملون ile başlayarak aynı surenin 61. ayetinin ortasında او بيوت امها(تكم) ile bitiyor."

This can be translated as follows: "28 E. H. 22 A part of the Qurʾān Parchment. 66 junk shaped leaves of 215 mm height and 300 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script of 2nd-3rd(8th-9th) centuries [contains] 5 lines measuring 200 mm. L. 1b contains illuminated borders with geometric interlaced patterns. Verse separators and sajdah roses (secde gülleri) are illuminated in the same style. Some leaves are worm-eaten and have been repaired with paper. Cherry brown leather binding with flap (miklep). The fragment begins with the words فمن اظلم ممن كذب على الله ... of Q 39:32 (Sūra al-Zumar). But the verses 50, 51, 52 of the same sūra were forgotten by the calligrapher/scribe, L. 17b. Q 40 (Sūra al-Muʾmin) continues until L. 49b and this sūra ends with the words في صدوركم ... of the verse 80. It continues from Q 24:51 (Sūra an-Nūr) until verse 53 of the same sūra, with verse 55 of the same sūra. And this sūra ends with the words دينهم الذى ارتضى لهم. L. 52a begins with the words إن الله خبير بما تعملون of the verse 53 of the same sūra and ends in the middle of the verse 61 of the same sūra, with the words او بيوت امها(تكم)."
